snippet: The number of seconds in a minute — and minutes in an hour — comes from the base-60 numeral system of ancient Mesopotamia.
abstract: Ancient Mesopotamian's base-60 numerical system underlies several aspects of modern time measurement, including seconds in minute, minutes in hour and days of year, as well as 360-degree circle; 60-based system has fallen out of favor for other types of measurement, though it is in many ways more efficient than 10-based system used by most modern societies.
lead_paragraph: The number of seconds in a minute — and minutes in an hour — comes from the base-60 numeral system of ancient Mesopotamia.

headline.main: 60: Behind Every Second, Millenniums of History
